page.title: 18Sutton-cum-Beckingham(Lincs)
page.content: A small hamlet which is affiliated to Beckingham with seven houses dotted along a lane about half a mile long which is part of the old coaching road from Newark to Sleaford. We have mains water and electricity, a daily postal service and a weekly refuse disposal service from Lincoln. There is no mains drainage system and sewage disposal has been done by North Kesteven District Council for the last 36 years but we have just received a letter saying that this service is now being put out to private tender. There is no shop but a baker's van and a greengrocer's van come down the lane each week. Some 31 years ago the then oldest inhabitant could remember a time when there were about 20 houses and a pub down the lane but there is no visible trace of these buildings today.
